docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 1. -- Lillian Runk, 28, formerly of New York City, was drowned on the Virginia side of the Potomac this afternoon while attempting to board a launch anchored out in the river. C. E. Ingling, Commodore of the Corinthian Yacht Club,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 1. -- Lillian Runk, 28, formerly of New York City, was drowned on the Virginia side of the Potomac this afternoon while attempting to board a launch anchored out in the river. C. E. Ingling, Commodore of the Corinthian Yacht Club, narrowly escaped the same fate in trying to save her.
docs.abstract: Runk, Lillian, lost trying to board launch on the Potomac

headline.main: NEW YORK GIRL DROWNS.; Lillian Runk Tried to Board a Launch on the Potomac.

docs.snippet: PARIS, June 8. -- The International Congress of Chambers of Commerce and Commercial and Industrial Associations was opened today in the great amphitheatre of the Sorbonne by Raoul Peret, French Minister of Commerce. About one thousand delegates were...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, June 8. -- The International Congress of Chambers of Commerce and Commercial and Industrial Associations was opened today in the great amphitheatre of the Sorbonne by Raoul Peret, French Minister of Commerce. About one thousand delegates were present. It is the sixth annual congress.

docs.snippet: Truman P. May, who used to be business manager of The Kansas City Times, went down to Buenos Aires last November with a view to making a considerable sum by introducing American novelties into the Argentine Republic and Uruguay. Mr. May left New York...
docs.lead_paragraph: Truman P. May, who used to be business manager of The Kansas City Times, went down to Buenos Aires last November with a view to making a considerable sum by introducing American novelties into the Argentine Republic and Uruguay. Mr. May left New York for Kansas City last night proclaiming that Argentina is no place for argonauts.

docs.snippet: PARIS, June 27. -- This week marks the inception of a project which may become an important factor in the relations of the United States of America with other nations on the American continents if it be realized on the scale contemplated.

docs.snippet: To national spirit, seeking fanatical vengeance, is to be ascribed the assassination of Francis Ferdinand and his wife. Bosnia was restive under Austro-Hungarian rule, and the discontent of late had grown in intensity.
docs.lead_paragraph: To national spirit, seeking fanatical vengeance, is to be ascribed the assassination of Francis Ferdinand and his wife. Bosnia was restive under Austro-Hungarian rule, and the discontent of late had grown in intensity.

headline.main: MANY RULERS FELL AT FANATICS' HANDS; Like Ferdinand and Duchess, They Were Victims of the Misguided National Spirit.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 18. -- Peace treaties have been agreed upon between the United States Government and the Governments of Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay. They will all be signed at the State Department early next week, when the recently negotiated...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 18. -- Peace treaties have been agreed upon between the United States Government and the Governments of Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay. They will all be signed at the State Department early next week, when the recently negotiated peace treaty with Chile will also be signed.
docs.abstract: treaties with A B C countries and with Uruguay ready

headline.main: ABC TREATIES READY.; Bryan Will Sign Them and Uruguayan Peace Agreement This Week.
